gurmukhi: qXwg gey n leI ien kI suD hoq kCU mn moh quhwry ] Awp rcy pur bwsn soN ienky sB pRym ibdw kir fwry ]
transliteration: Tyaag Gad Na Laaiin Kisudh Hot Kachhodh Man Moh Tuhdare|| Oop Rache Pur Baasan Son In-ke Sabh Prem Bidaa Kar(i) Ddare||
translation: “You have not communicated at all with these residents of Braja; does no attachment arise in your mind? You yourself had been absorbed with the inhabitants of the city and had relinquished all the love of these people;

gurmukhi: qw qy n mwn kro iPir Awvhu jIqq By qumhU hm hwry ] qw qy qjo mQurw iPr Awvhu hy sB gaUAin kY rKvwry ]952]
transliteration: Taa Te Na Maan Daro Phir(i) Aavoh Jeetat Bhe Toumhoo Ham Hdare|| Taa Te Tajo Mathuraa Phir Aavoh He Sabh Gadoan(i) Kai Rakhvdare||952||
translation: “O Krishna ! do not persist now; it is right to say that you have won and we have been defeated; O Krishna, the protector of cows ! now leave Mathura and come here again.”952.

gurmukhi: sXwm icqwr kY sXwm khY mn mY sB gÍwrnIXw duK pwvY ] eyk prY murJwie Drw iek bXog BeI gun bXog hI gwvY ]
transliteration: Syaam Chiaar Kai Syaam Kahai Man Mai Sabh Gvaarneeyaa Doukh Paavai|| Ek Darai Murjhaae Dharaa Ik Byog Bhaigoun Byog Higadvai||
translation: Remembering Krishna, the poet says that all the gopis are suffering; someone on becoming unconscious is falling separation;

gurmukhi: koaU khY jdurw muK qy suin sRaunn bwq qhw eyaU DwvY ] jau ipKvY n qhw iqn ko su khY hmko hir hwQ n AwvY ]953]
transliteration: Ko( i)  Kahai Jaduraa Moukh Te Soun(i) Sraounan Baat Tahaa Eoo Dhaavai|| Jau Pikhvai Na Tahaa Tin Ko Su Kahai Hamko Har(i) Haath Na Aavai||953||
translation: Someone is running hither and thither shouting the name of Krishna and listening to the sound of his moving feet with her ears and when does not see him, she says in her state of worry that she is not getting at Krishna.953.

gurmukhi: gÍwrin bXwkul ic`q BeI hir ky nhI Awvn kI suD pweI ] bXwkul hoie geI icq mY biRKBwn suqw mn mY murJweI ]
transliteration: Gvaaran(i) Byaakul Chitt Bhaihar(i) Ke Nahiaavan Kisudh Paaee|| Byaakul Hoe Gadchit Mai Brikhbhaan Soutaa Man Mai Murjhaaee||
translation: The gopis are greatly worried and they have no inkling of the coming of Krishna; Radha, being in great anguish, has become lifeless;

gurmukhi: jo ibrQw mn bIc huqI soaU aUDv ky iqh pws sunweI ] sXwm n Awvq hY iqh qy Aiq hI duK BXo brnXo nhI jweI ]954]
transliteration: Jo Birthaa Man Beech Houtisooo Oodhav Ke Tih Paas Sounaaee|| Syaam Na Aavat Hai Tih Te At(i) Hidoukh Bhayo Barnyo Nahijaaee||954||
translation: Whatever agony she had in her mind, she talked about that to Udhava adding that Krishna was not coming and the suffering was indescribable.954.

gurmukhi: aUDv au`qr dyq BXo Aiq bXog mnY Apny soaU kY hY ] gÍwrin ky mD m`iD ibKY kib sXwm khY joaU bwq rcY hY ]
transliteration: Oodhav Outtar Det Bhayo At(i) Manai Apne Sooo Kai Hai|| Gvaaran(i) Ke Madh Madhh(i) Bikhai Kabi Syaam Kahai Jooo Baat Rachai Hai||
translation: Udhava also extremely worred, talked thus amongst the gopis; that

gurmukhi: Qory hI dXosin mY imil hY ijh ky aur mY n kCU BRm BY hY ] jogin hoie jpo hir ko suK mwNghu gI qum so br dYhY ]955]
transliteration: Thore Hidyosan(i) Mai Mil(i) Hai Jih Ke Ur Mai Na Kachhodh Bhram Bhai Hai|| Jogad(i) Hoe Japo Har(i) Ko Moukh Maanoh Gitoum So Bar Dai-hai||955||
translation: Fearless Krishna would be meeting them within a few days; become like a Yogi and meditate on him; he will grant you whatever boon you will ask him.955.

gurmukhi: aun dY iem aUDv gXwn clXo cil kY jsuDw piq pYsoaU AwXo ] Awvq hI jsuDw jsuDwpiq pwien aUpr sIs JukwXo ]
transliteration: Oun Dai Im Oodhav Gyaan Chadyo Chal(i) Kai Jasudhaa Pat(i) Paisooo Aayo|| Oovat Hijasudhaa Jasudhaa-pat(i) Paaeen Oopar Sees Jhoukaayo||
translation: After talking words of wisdom with the gopis, Udhava came to meet Nand; both Yashoda and Nand bowed their heads at his feet;
